desc: We are coordinating a video for a client to serve as a sales piece for them, featuring a 3 or 4 of their clients from around the country giving testimonials to the value that our client provided. This video will also include some scripted portions, and we will develop those and edit all the footage. But rather than travel to the different locations, we're looking to subcontract a video producer for each city to go to a client's office and film interviewing them with the questions we would provide. We'd anticipate the interview would take no longer than 30 minutes, planning to select a few key quotes from each client, and edit down into a 3-5 minute final video. Looking for a videographer who can help scout a good location to film when on-site, and ensure professional lighting and sound, then send raw footage for us to edit. Depending on travel time, the whole project should take no more than half a day.
title: Shoot client interview/testimonial for sales video (Burlington, VT Area)

desc: We are looking for a native English speaker to do a screen capture video to introduce our not-yet-released email marketing tool called Verifigator. Basically, you can get the idea what Verifigator is and what it does from its introduction blog post: [url removed, login to view]There are two features of the product you can access via the website: the Demo which you can access without signing up, and the List Manager, which is the actual product our customers will be using. To see that, you need to register (which is free, of course).We have some ideas what we would want from the introduction video, but we'd like to hear your ideas. Do you have a great idea how to show off the world what our product can do? Tell me your idea and you'll get the job. Do you have an idea that includes more than one video? Great! We can do a series of videos!But for now, please tell me a brief idea of what kind of video you'd want to do, your bid (price) and your estimated delivery time and we'll take it from there. In your bid, please show some videos you have done before.Note: Native English speakers only. And we are not looking for professional video studio job with actors in suits. We are looking more like a Youtuber reviewing a product type of production and most likely a video in the form of screen capture of you using our product with an audio of you explaining what you are doing on the screen.
title: Create a video for Youtube to introduce an email marketing tool

desc: I need a short 3d animated video which we can use on our web site (I will eventually need several of these but initially just 1). Video will be about 30 seconds and a storyboard will be provided.General project description is the story of a company executive developing a compliance project in preparation for the General Data Protection Regulation. We will need a central character who will be able to be used in multiple videos and branding. In the first video the character will walk into the scene where an array of 12 hexagons laid out in a question mark shape are present on the floor. As the character approaches the hexagons they extrude upwards out of the floor forming steps. Each step has a word on it and as the character jumps on to each step there is an animated particle effect (like sparkles) and a text related to the word on the step appears (all words and related texts will be provided).Once the character jumps off the step to the next one, the step turns blue and has a yellow star on it (signifying the European flag - where there are twelve yellow stars on a blue background). When the character gets to the last step all the hexagons will animate into a circle with a top view (creating the EU circle of yellow stars) and some final text will appear in the middle of the circle.I would prefer it if someone creates this in Blender but will accept 3DSMax or Maya if no Blender users are available.
title: Blender Project

title: Project for Zia T.

When the character gets to the last step all the hexagons will animate into a circle with a top view (creating the EU circle of yellow stars) and some final text will appear in the middle of the circle.I would prefer it if someone creates this in Blender but will accept 3DSMax or Maya if no Blender users are available.
